6) Suggested resources would include such persons as:
Solon J. Buck, THE GRANGER MOVEMENT
John D« Hicks, THE POPULIST REVOLT
Mary Beard, THE AMERICAN SPIRIT and others
Samuel Peter Orth, THE ARMIES OF LABOR
Harold U. Faulkner, LABOR IN AMERICA
Samuel Yellen, AMERICAN LABOR STRUGGLES
Other resources suggested include the Brookings Institution, through President
Robert Calkins; Mr, Elbert Burr of the Monsanto Chemical Co. j 14*. Lawrence Rogan
of the TWA (Textile Workers); Dr. Edwin Young of the University of Wisconsin
Department of Labor Education; Professor Joseph MLre of the same institution; and
Mr. Saul D. Alinsky, well-known author and student of the American labor and
industrial scene.
7) Proposed format: If possible, this series should be planned in terms of
13 half-hour programs divided generally within the broad range suggested above.
They should be a combination of dramatic, documentary, and talk presentations utilizing
the resources of such people as Robben W. Fleming, Director of the University of
Illinois Institute of Labor and Industrial Relations, and other comparable labor
and industry institutes. Labor leaders and representatives of industrial groups^
would also be invited to participate as well as to suggest materials and consultants
to assist with the series.
